intro: Dolichostegia boholensis, commonly known as the Bohol flatleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its flat, leathery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland areas and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields. Its botanical features include a slender stem and small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Dolichostegia boholensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
